choices.C: RPC uses the POST operation to update and REST uses the PUT operation to update.
choices.A: RPC uses HTML format and REST uses JSON format.
choices.D: RPC is stateful in nature and REST is stateless in nature.
choices.B: RPC has a single style and REST has multiple styles

B is correct, Basic authentication uses Base64 converting the string 'username:password'.
Bearer <token here> is for OAuth
Authentication its a request header, and payload its the included data, so it cant be A, only B fits.

Anonymous (no authentication)

 Basic (Base64-encoded credentials as username:password)

 Bearer (HTTP implementation of custom token authentication)

 Digest (MD5-hashed credentials)

 Mutual (two-way authentication)

 More uncommon schemes (HMAC, HOBA, AWS, OAuth, Negotiate, and so on)
It should be D , as B mention basic not bearer
